title: Understanding Opioid Use Disorder Treatment
text: Opioid use disorder is a medical condition characterized by the problematic use of opioid drugs. Treatment often involves medications that help manage withdrawal symptoms and reduce cravings.

title: FDA-Approved Medications
text: The FDA has approved certain medications specifically for the treatment of opioid use disorder. These medications are designed to help individuals reduce or quit their use of opioids.

title: Identifying the Medications
text: Which of the following are FDA-approved medications for opioid use disorder?
choices: morphine, oxycodone, hydrocodone, fentanyl, and hydromorphone
